results.title: Father of the bride
results.creator_credit: Charles Shyer, Howard Rosenman, Nancy Meyers, Carol Baum and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Steve Martin stars in this fairly rudimentary remake of the Spencer Tracey/Elizabeth Taylor original of 1950, directed by Vincente Minnelli. On her wedding day, the bride’s harried father reminisces over the rocky journey from proposal to ring swapping, for he and his family. Feeling increasingly sidelined by the trappings of the big day, George Banks (Martin) gets in to no end of trouble as he tries to steer his way through the mysterious rites of modern marrying whilst also recognising that his daughter is all grown up. Also stars Dianne Keaton and Kieran Culkin.

results.title: Greetings
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Charles Hirsch and West End Film
results.brief_description: A film very representative of the era and place in which it was made - New York late 1960s. “Greetings”, directed by Brian De Palma, is about three hip intellectual young men who come up with some novel ideas on how to avoid the draft that will send them to the conflict in Vietnam. Paul (Jonathan Warden), Jon (Robert De Niro) and Lloyd (Geritt Graham) present as gay and extreme right-wingers to the army all the while trying their best to seduce women to keep themselves occupied. This is a witty and satirical view of American culture at the time and is more a series of fun episodes in the protagonists’ lives than a straight-forward narrative. Co-written by Brian De Palma and Charles Hirsch and also edited by De Palma. Music by ‘The Children of Paradise’.

results.title: The Hit
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jeremy Thomas and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: In this early Stephen Frears feature, Terence Stamp plays Willie Parker, a philosophising mobster who adopts a tranquil life in Spain after betraying several cohorts. Ten years on they track him down, and two crims, Braddock and Myron, are charged with driving him across Spain en route to Paris where he will be assassinated. The journey is complicated by Willie’s ability to undermine Braddock (a young hot-shot, keen to impress) and Myron (a cool professional). Although tension and violence infuse the set-up, the film is marked by dark humour, and enhanced by Terence Stamp’s wry performance. Cast also includes John Hurt, Tim Roth, and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Dogwatch
results.creator_credit: Laurie McInnes, Richard Brennan, Black Ray Films, Smile Production and AFFC
results.brief_description: From the director of “Broken Highway”, “Dogwatch” is a thriller set at sea aboard a rusty cargo ship with equally as dubious a crew. Captained by alcoholic and corrupt skipper (Steven Vidler) aka ‘The Judas Captain’, the doomed ship is to be sunk by Heckle, the first mate (John Brumpton) once the captain has navigated the vessel to deep waters - all paid for by Triad gangsters. The hapless (sometimes farcical) crew and mysteriously cryptic Palmer (Russell Kiefel) make the journey unbearable for the captain. Stopping off to do a bit of gun smuggling in exchange for gold, the crew discover a stench in the hold and as one crew member points out ‘The Triad’ that organised this cruise won’t be expecting anyone to return. Mutiny and murder take over the minds of the crew as each man tries to assert his will and survive the situation in which they find themselves. Written and directed by Laurie McInnes. Cast includes Richard Carter, Joel Edgerton, John Alansu, Yaw Glymin.

results.title: Pickup on South Street = Pick up on South Street
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Jules Schermer and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Iconic film noir set in New York about a pickpocket who lifts microfilm bearing US secrets from the handbag of the former mistress of a Communist spy. Sam Fuller combines brisk pacing with sizzling dialogue to create a masterful political thriller that plays upon the over-ripe fears of Communism, espionage and political conspiracy. Richard Windmark plays a wonderfully amoral Skip McCoy, a freshly sprung jailbird, trying to play for all best angles, in an increasingly dangerous game he barely comprehends. Also stars the peerless Thelma Ritter as a street-wise grifter and Jean Peters as the louche femme fatale.

results.title: Samsara
results.creator_credit: Pan Nalin, Christoph Friedel, Karl Baumgartner, Paradis Films, Pandora Films, Ocean Films and Fandango
results.brief_description: A young Buddhist returns from three years of meditative solitude, to the monastery where he grew up. As his fellow monks gently reawaken Tashi to the physical world, he simultaneously experiences physical arousal and an interest in women. Despite the efforts of his master to dissuade him, Tashi feels he must encounter the real world in order to renounce it. Hence begins Tashi’s journey of sex, marriage, and industry among a remote mountain community. Set in Ladakh, in the Himalayas, “Samsara” is spectacularly beautiful whilst also successfully conveying the trials of life for this village. Tashi - although enjoying the bliss of sex and pleasure of marriage - is ill-prepared for the conflicts of life as an ordinary man. Christy Chung, playing Tashi’s wife, provides a grounded perspective of what spirituality truly means in everyday life.

results.title: Nine queens = Nueve Reinas
results.creator_credit: Fabian Belinsky, Pablo Bossi and Patagonik Film Group
results.brief_description: Impressive debut from Argentinean filmmaker Fabian Belinsky, sees two con-artists link up, despite their mutual mistrust and misgivings, in order to pull off increasingly complex, daring and lucrative scams. This culminates in a scheme to sell a valuable sheet of stamps, the Nine Queens of the title, to a wealthy businessman. To do this the pair must continuously re-invent the set-up and its execution. Reminiscent of the work of David Mamet, Belinsky keeps the audience delightfully bewildered by the state of play as the narrative threads gradually unravel. An amusing and clever addition to the caper genre.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fabian Belinsky, Pablo Bossi and Patagonik Film Group

results.title: Forty guns = 40 guns
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Globe Enterprises and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A classic example of the Western genre, written, directed and produced by maverick Samuel Fuller. Shot in black and white and “cinemascope” this lush film is filled with all you would expect from a Western: guns, fancy horse riding, showdowns and a bit of romance. The tough town femme-fatale Jessica Drummond (Barbara Stanwyck) has a posse of forty hired guns that make her the de facto leader of the County. She falls in love with a Marshall (Barry Sullivan) who arrives to restore law and order with tensions building up to a showdown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samuel Fuller, Globe Enterprises and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Cube
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Natali, Betty Orr, Mehra Meh, Cube Libre, Feature Film Project and Trimark Pictures
results.brief_description: First time director Vincenzo Natali’s low budget thriller is a tribute to the ensemble cast performances as well as his direction. The action takes place in what appears to be an experiment in human survival as a select group of people wake up contained within the walls of a cube, twenty-six identical rooms wide and twenty-six high. How they got there is not made clear but finding their way out is the whole premise of the film. The skill-sets of this particular group of people aid or hinder their survival - for example, an old thief works out a way to find out if a room is booby-trapped or not - and survival is at stake because the cube kills and this is shown in scenes of visceral gore. The production design by Jasna Stefanovic, music by Mark Karven and some very believable special effects add to the tense but dreamlike sci-fi mood of the film. Human behaviour under stress provides the viewer with a gripping and edgy personal drama - even though ‘participants’ have been de-humanised by being used like guinea pigs in a maze. Cast includes Nicole DeBoer, Nicky Guardagni, David Hewlett, Andrew Miller, Julian Richings, Wayne Robson and Maurice Dean Wint.

description_for_label: First time director Vincenzo Natali’s low budget thriller is a tribute to the ensemble cast performances as well as his direction. The action takes place in what appears to be an experiment in human survival as a select group of people wake up contained within the walls of a cube, twenty-six identical rooms wide and twenty-six high. How they got there is not made clear but finding their way out is the whole premise of the film. The skill-sets of this particular group of people aid or hinder their survival - for example, an old thief works out a way to find out if a room is booby-trapped or not - and survival is at stake because the cube kills and this is shown in scenes of visceral gore. The production design by Jasna Stefanovic, music by Mark Karven and some very believable special effects add to the tense but dreamlike sci-fi mood of the film. Human behaviour under stress provides the viewer with a gripping and edgy personal drama - even though ‘participants’ have been de-humanised by being used like guinea pigs in a maze. Cast includes Nicole DeBoer, Nicky Guardagni, David Hewlett, Andrew Miller, Julian Richings, Wayne Robson and Maurice Dean Wint.

results.title: The Maids
results.creator_credit: Christopher Miles, Robert Enders, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Adapted from French playwright, Jean Genet’s absurdist play, “The Maids” is about a pair of sisters caught up in a twisted play-acting game whereby their antipathy for their mistress and for each other, is revealed. After having her husband framed and imprisoned, the sisters, employed as maids for Madame, plan to poison her. In her temporary absence however they fantasise about dominance, wealth and power with Claire (Susannah York) acting as Madame, whilst Solange (Glenda Jackson) alternately fawns over then rants mercilessly, spitting out endless bile that speaks of her own self-loathing and hatred for her class. The film presents an impressive, and appropriate, sense of claustrophobia as the two women steer along a tragic course. Stellar cast also includes Vivien Merchant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Miles, Robert Enders, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization
